They documented, cataloged, and formalized 23 commonly used design patterns. We're not going to go over all 23, but I must note that all 23 do fall into three buckets. Creational patterns are all about object creation. So instead of creating objects directly, these patterns give you more flexibility on how objects come into existence. Structural patterns, that's the second category, deal with how objects relate to each other. Think of them as blueprints for building something, building larger structures from individual pieces like Legos.
